urls.description: Floating pennywort is a highly invasive aquatic plant that was first introduced to Britain as an ornamental pond plant in the 1990‚Äô s. In the wild, this species can grow up to 20cm a day and rapidly forms dense floating mats of weed across waterbodies. These crowd out native species, block light impacting on the aquatic ecosystem, interfere with activities such as angling, paddling and sailing, and potentially increase the flood risk.
